    level="1"
    right="Feat 12"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Janatimo's Lessons](/Feats.aspx?ID=2166) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Rare" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=137" />
<trait label="Archetype" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=12" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Legends](/Sources.aspx?ID=40) pg. 61</row>

**Archetype** [Magaambyan Attendant](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=29)

**Prerequisites**
[Uzunjati Recollection](/Feats.aspx?ID=1114)

</column>

---

Thanks to Janatimo's secret techniques, you can weave your knowledge and words into powerful tools to assist your allies in life-threatening situations. When you use [Uzunjati Recollection](/Feats.aspx?ID=1114) to tell a story and [Recall Knowledge](/Actions.aspx?ID=26) about a creature during a combat encounter, if you succeed at both checks, your story carries deeper meaning. This grants your allies a +1 circumstance bonus to their next attack roll and saving throw against the creature during that encounter, as well as to their AC against that creature's next attack roll during that encounter. If you critically succeed at both checks, the bonuses also apply to all attack rolls, saves, and AC against that creature for 2 rounds.

<title level="2">Janatimo's Secret Lessons</title>

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Legends](/Sources.aspx?ID=40) pg. 61</row>

As a storyteller, Janatimo loves sharing his knowledge with others and helping expand their worldviews, so most of his innovations have passed on to the Uzunjati or the world at large. But there are a few small things he keeps to himself and his closest friends and students, among those a special Uzunjati storytelling technique that could be used to harm the innocent if it fell into the wrong hands.
